What are you looking for? Advanced Search Home > All Categories > Social Science > Gender Studies > Resolved Question Νeo is bringing on the heartbrea... Member since: October 24, 2010 Total points: 36,922 (Level 7) Badge Image: Add Contact Block
Resolved Question Show me another » How is taking a date to McDonald's being"cheap"but a coffee shop isn't? Based on what I've read here (and even heard from women I know)....
The general consensus of taking a woman to McDonald's for a first date lunch/dinner makes the guy seem"cheap."The general thought of meeting for coffee (chain or local place) is seen as an acceptable venue.
Let's break this down when Jack meets Jill for a first date in two scenarios: At McD's, She orders an Angus burger upsized meal AND has an ice cream sundae. Cost is about $7. At Caribou Coffee, she orders a coffee drink for $3.50.
So, in this scenario, Jack just spent twice as much at McD's than he would at Caribou Coffee yet he is considered"cheap"for taking her to McD's?
And I've been to some McD's where they have fancier wood trim to make the place look less"plastic"and a little nicer. So, it really isn't about ambiance.
Please help me sort through this fiscal dilemma my dearest GS associates (and those who wander into this forum). 3 months ago Report Abuse
Additional Details @PEACE: Good point. A bunch of rowdy kids can make for an unpleasant environment. 3 months ago by Neil Member since: November 24, 2008 Total points: 63,474 (Level 7) Badge Image: Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker We got weed at our Coffeeshop, so she'd be very, very mellow.
Rule of thumb though, don't take her anywhere, where you can have a children's party. 3 months ago Report Abuse
4 people rated this as good Asker's Rating: Asker's Comment: Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 0 ) Save Add to My Yahoo! Add to Del.icio.us RSS
There are currently no comments for this question.
* You must be logged into Answers to add comments. Sign in or Register .
Other Answers (11) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by sarah Member since: April 11, 2012 Total points: 142 (Level 1) Add Contact Block A coffee shop looks much more professional then a fast food resturant would. Fast food resturants are for quick on the go meals while coffee shops is a place to sit back and relax with a nice coffee. At least thats what I think. The women also probably doesnt want to"gain to much ascess weight"from the high calorie food served at mcdonalds. Source(s): A women. 3 months ago Report Abuse
1 person rated this as good by Melody is off her meds Member since: February 13, 2012 Total points: 2,165 (Level 3) Add Contact Block It's not that it's cheap but it's not very romantic sort of. I went out once with a guy to McDonald's and I had no problem with it knowing that he is in college with me so we need to be tight on money...Although I would have preferred just coffee because we can talk instead of trying to figure out how to eat big Mac! 3 months ago Report Abuse by Gender Stu Member since: July 22, 2010 Total points: 25,500 (Level 7) Badge Image: Add Contact Block It isn't cheap, based solely on the amount spent. Women who see it as cheap probably just consider it appropriate to pay significantly more for a meal than for a cup of coffee. Source(s): McD's also has coffee, btw. Limit her to getting a coffee or tea, and she should have no problem with it. 3 months ago Report Abuse
1 person rated this as good by Me Enamora Member since: August 07, 2009 Total points: 1,031 (Level 3) Add Contact Block I don't consider going to McDonalds as cheap. Actually it's better because you get your food faster lol, but I don't eat at McDonalds anyway since I'm a vegetarian. Burger King does have a veggie burger though lol.
Actually McDonalds is only a little less than the food at Applebee's or Fridays. 3 months ago Report Abuse by Lil G Member since: December 05, 2009 Total points: 1,762 (Level 3) Add Contact Block Because when you go out for a coffee, you get to talk and get to know eachother. When your in McD's your stuffing your face on fast food- not really attractive for a first date is it?
If you really want to take her somewhere to eat, then choose somehwere like the olive garden or something more fancier. 3 months ago Report Abuse
2 people rated this as good by victoria Member since: April 04, 2012 Total points: 277 (Level 2) Add Contact Block Because in some sense McDonalds is seen as trashy It's sort of low class
Now somewhere like Starbucks or another coffee shop, it looks classier. Its also jus coffee so it's a laidback date
Answer mine? http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index;… 3 months ago Report Abuse
2 people rated this as good by Jayanthi Member since: March 14, 2012 Total points: 1,284 (Level 3) Add Contact Block Math or money calculation does not pierce the thick curtain of prejudiced/wrong perception. McDonald is considered as fast food restaurant&cheap ($1 items are available if you like). Coffee shop or Restaurants are not considered as cheap and they are not branded as fast food eateries. Source(s): Me 3 months ago Report Abuse by Guitar virgin Member since: June 02, 2011 Total points: 7,474 (Level 5) Add Contact Block When you make a comparison you need to compare like with like. Comparing a MEAL at McDonald's with only a DRINK at Caribou Coffee is not comparing like with like. 3 months ago Report Abuse
1 person rated this as good by Grandpa S Member since: September 17, 2007 Total points: 16,597 (Level 6) Badge Image: Add Contact Block Why do you care? Take her out for coffee, if that's what she wants, and use the savings to buy yourself a burger later. 3 months ago Report Abuse
2 people rated this as good by LifeQues... Member since: March 02, 2012 Total points: 17,873 (Level 6) Badge Image: Add Contact Block Why you little....by coffee, I meant a macchiato with a twist of lemon peel. McD's coffee's dishwater. 3 months ago Report Abuse
3 people rated this as good by Aussie Guy Member since: December 11, 2009 Total points: 2,640 (Level 4) Add Contact Block Well I hate McDonald's and Coffee shops. Edited 3 months ago Report Abuse
